page.content: ago but future planning was clearly faulty since so much emphasis on transport and its cost is now evident. The fall in population was also not spotted since all First Schools now have excess accomodation, whilst the Middle School has on occasion been overcrowded. Dissatisfaction is felt with the excessive amount of time (at least 1 1/2 hours) some children spend on buses each day. Some parents in this area prefer to send their children to independent fee paying schools, Worcester being the most popular. The 1982 Education Act gave parents more freedom of choice in the schooling of their children which they now exercise. There still remains a hardcore of exceptionally supportive parents to the local village school who do their utmost to help in these times of economic stringency.
